etymologies: Middle English: via Old French from Latin codex, codic- (see codex). The term originally denoted a systematic collection of statutes made by Justinian or another of the later Roman emperors; compare with code (sense 3 of the noun) (mid 18th century), the earliest modern sense

definitions: a system of words, letters, figures, or other symbols substituted for other words, letters, etc., especially for the purposes of secrecy

examples.text: the Americans cracked their diplomatic code

shortDefinitions: system of words, figures, etc. used to represent others

definitions: a system of signals, such as sounds, light flashes, or flags, used to send messages
shortDefinitions: system of signals used to send messages

definitions: a series of letters, numbers, or symbols assigned to something for the purposes of classification or identification

examples.text: calls with either code will work in the 201 area

shortDefinitions: series of letters, numbers, etc. used for classification

definitions: a systematic collection of laws or regulations
a set of conventions governing behavior or activity in a particular sphere
a set of rules and standards adhered to by a society, class, or individual
shortDefinitions: set of rules and standards adhered to by society

definitions: convert (the words of a message) into a particular code in order to convey a secret meaning

examples.text: only Mitch knew how to read the message—even the name was coded

definitions: express the meaning of (a statement or communication) in an indirect or euphemistic way

examples.text: they code their language when talking to the general public

definitions: assign a code to (something) for purposes of classification, analysis, or identification

examples.text: she coded the samples and sent them down for dissection
most developers code C + + like C
I no longer actively code in PHP

definitions: specify the genetic sequence for (an amino acid or protein)

examples.text: genes that code for human growth hormone

shortDefinitions: be genetic code for amino acid

definitions: be the genetic determiner of (a characteristic)

examples.text: one pair of homologous chromosomes codes for eye color
